definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to seem/like/as/if
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: I know their tricks and stratagems.
sentences.chinese: 我对他们的花招和战略洞若观火。

definition: to clearly understand
to see everything clearly
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
lit. seeing clearly the downy feathers of autumn (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. perceptive of even the finest detail
subtle way of thinking (idiom); hard to fathom/deep and shrewd

see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
penetrated/trenchant/incisive
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
to estimate/to surmise/to appraise
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
far-sighted/astute
to prophesy with supernatural accuracy (idiom)/to have an incredible foresight
